last_episode_to_air.name: Israel and Love
last_episode_to_air.overview: Israel finds first love with the daughter of a flamboyant woodcarver.

name: Daniel Boone
overview: Daniel Boone is an American action-adventure television series starring Fess Parker as Daniel Boone that aired from September 24, 1964 to September 10, 1970 on NBC for 165 episodes, and was made by 20th Century Fox Television. Ed Ames co-starred as Mingo, Boone's Cherokee friend, for the first four seasons of the series. Albert Salmi portrayed Boone's companion Yadkin in season one only. Dallas McKennon portrayed innkeeper Cincinnatus. Country Western singer-actor Jimmy Dean was a featured actor as Josh Clements during the 1968â€“1970 seasons. Actor and former NFL football player Rosey Grier made regular appearances as Gabe Cooper in the 1969 to 1970 season. The show was broadcast "in living color" beginning in fall 1965, the second season, and was shot entirely in California and Kanab, Utah.

episodes.name: Ken-Tuck-E
episodes.overview: George Washington sends Daniel and Yadkin into Ken-Tuck-E, the dark and bloody hunting ground of four Indian nations, to find a site for a fort.

episodes.name: Tekawitha McLeod
episodes.overview: A dance at Fort Boonesborough is interrupted by Flathead Joseph, a halfbreed slave trader. He has a young Indian girl with him whom he claims is a Cherokee Princess...and a white girl. Her name is Tekawitha McLeod and she is the daughter of the Cherokee Chief Menewa. When Daniel confronts Menewa about this he admits she is white and taken from a raiding party but he wants her back. Daniel refuses when he realizes he knew her family. The Indians are determined to fight to get her back and the settlers of Boonesborough are just as determined to fight to keep her.

episodes.name: My Brother's Keeper
episodes.overview: Mingo, wanted DEAD! Daniel Boone must capture his friend Mingo and bring him to justice before all Kentucky erupts in war. Daniel's friend Yadkin is a trusted friend to all in Booneborough and among the Cherokee. Yadkin had canoed up river and while meeting with a Cherokee trading party when they were ambushed by a Creek war party. Yadkin was found floating down river by Daniel's son Israel. With Cincinnatus removing the slug(bullet) and Rebecca Boone nursing him, he began to pull through....

episodes.name: The Family Fluellen
episodes.overview: Boone invites a widow and her hungry brood to town, but one of the children steals a telescope.

episodes.name: The Choosing
episodes.overview: British soldiers and Indians surround Jemima as she tries to help Boone, wounded in the wilderness.

episodes.name: Lac Duquesne
episodes.overview: Boone chases a river pirate who plans to sell a load of stolen arms to Shawnees.

episodes.name: The Sound of Wings
episodes.overview: A British officer captures Boone then impersonates him to win Indian allies.

episodes.name: A Short Walk to Salem
episodes.overview: Israel becomes lost in the woods after fur thieves ambush him, Boone and Yadkin.

episodes.name: The Sisters O'Hannrahan
episodes.overview: Yadkin's trickery leaves Boone the unexpected, and unwilling, owner of indentured Irish sisters.

episodes.name: Pompey
episodes.overview: A bondsman insists on returning a runaway slave unshackled by Boone.

episodes.name: Mountain of the Dead
episodes.overview: A dream about a man whom Daniel thought was dead is followed by the appearance of three men at his door demanding that he take them to the site of a bloody Native American massacre.

episodes.name: Not in Our Stars
episodes.overview: Mingo plans to do more than protest a new treaty when he and Boone visit Virginia's governor general.

episodes.name: The Hostages
episodes.overview: Rumors circulate that the British are employing Indians to fight for them. Daniel becomes personally involved when he gets word his wife Rebecca has been taken by an Indian raiding party.

episodes.name: The Returning
episodes.overview: Boone cannot believe a boyhood friend murdered two Cherokee youths.

episodes.name: The Prophet
episodes.overview: A Shawnee prophet predicts massacre for the settlers of Boonesborough.

episodes.name: The First Stone
episodes.overview: Boone befriends a mother and son, but learns the woman is accused of witchcraft.

episodes.name: A Place of 1000 Spirits
episodes.overview: While hunting, the Boones meet a delirious British officer pursued by vengeful Shawnees.

episodes.name: The Sound of Fear
episodes.overview: A condemned bounty hunter who escaped from a military convoy takes the Boones hostage.

episodes.name: The Price of Friendship
episodes.overview: Boone assists a boy and winds up at the mercy of a larcenous clan.

episodes.name: The Quietists
episodes.overview: A Quaker family refuses to fight until Indians kidnap a daughter.

episodes.name: The Devil's Four
episodes.overview: Boone commands four criminals recruited by Yadkin to haul frieght to Boonesborough.

episodes.name: The Reunion
episodes.overview: While out hunting, Daniel and Cincinnatus come upon Timothy who is looking for his abandonded daughter Becky.

episodes.name: The Ben Franklin Encounter
episodes.overview: Boone and Mingo travel East and get caught up in a confrontation between Benjamin Franklin and British Admiral Lord Clydesdale, who threatens to hang them all for treason.

episodes.name: Four-Leaf Clover
episodes.overview: An idealistic schoolteacher incites Boonesborough's wrath by giving gunpowder to the Shawnees.

episodes.name: Cain's Birthday (1)
episodes.overview: Boone seems guilty of betrayal when he allows Choctaws to capture the town's men

episodes.name: Cain's Birthday (2)
episodes.overview: Lacking water and powder, the women and children of Boonesborough seem easy prey for attacking Choctaws.

episodes.name: Daughter of the Devil
episodes.overview: A man is found dead by a group of travelers, one of them hears a strange noise and believes it to be the Devil in the form of a black panther. Daniel and Mingo believe a far more mundane explanation is at hand, and investigate to prove their point.

episodes.name: Doll of Sorrow
episodes.overview: Israel accidentally startles a passing peddler's horse and his goods are ruined. Daniel agrees to compensate him for his loss but matters are complicated when he steals a grieving Indian women's mourning doll.

episodes.name: The Courtship of Jericho Jones
episodes.overview: Jericho and Sumah, the daughter of the Indian chief, want to marry. Daniel proposes a trial engagement. For a month Jericho will live with the Indians and Sumah will live with Boone's family and see if each can adapt to the other culture.

episodes.name: Empire of the Lost
episodes.overview: Boone returns from a solo expedition to find Boonesborough eerily empty. A corrupt British officer has kidnapped the settlers, including Boone's family, and forces them into unfriendly Chickesaw tribal lands with the intention of gaining personal control of the territory. He then captures Boone and demands that he sign away all rights to Boonesborough or watch his family and friends be turned over to the tribe. Boone manages to escape, but realizing he has no chance of freeing the captives on his own, he turns to a surprising source of help.

episodes.name: The Tortoise and the Hare
episodes.overview: Boonesborough loses hope of winning an annual race when Boone sprains his ankle, until Jericho steps in.

episodes.name: The Mound Builders
episodes.overview: A chief of a long-dead Aztec tribe enters the Shawnees Valley of Death.

episodes.name: My Name Is Rawls
episodes.overview: Boone pursues a runaway slave stealing pelts to earn passage to Africa.

episodes.name: The Old Man and the Cave
episodes.overview: Israel violates a burial ritual when he rescues an aged Indian from death in a cave.

episodes.name: The Trek
episodes.overview: Boone first respects, then likes, a drunkard sought for burning an Indian village.

episodes.name: The Aaron Burr Story
episodes.overview: Aaron Burr, ex-Vice President, comes to Boonesborough to enlist Daniel to guide him on a long and dangerous journey to the west, but is vague about his reasons for the trek. When Daniel turns him down due to his unease about Burr's secretive intentions, Jericho blindly jumps at the chance to take the offer and earn a hefty fee. After Burr and Jericho leave, Daniel discovers Burr's true mission, and he and Mingo set out to intercept them and save Jericho from his own naivety.

episodes.name: Cry of Gold
episodes.overview: A man arrives at Boonesborough offering unusually high prices for beaver pelts. Daniel doesn't trust this generous trader and soon discovers the man has an ulterior motive of a sinister nature.

episodes.name: The Peace Tree
episodes.overview: A Scottish emigrant, a Cherokee chief s son and Israel try to prevent a war between settlers and Indians.

episodes.name: The Thanksgiving Story
episodes.overview: Boone s eccentric father-in-law concocts a Thanksgiving Day plan to prevent a Choctaw attack.

episodes.name: A Rope for Mingo
episodes.overview: Vigilantes stalk Mingo after his knife falls into the hands of a Cherokee who murders a trader s family.

episodes.name: The First Beau
episodes.overview: Feelings for Jemima make a dashing young outlaw consider reforming.

episodes.name: The Perilous Journey
episodes.overview: Daniel and Rebecca finally get to take a long delayed honeymoon but it gets interrupted by an officer of the Continental Army with a confidential message for Daniel to deliver to New Orleans.

episodes.name: The Christmas Story
episodes.overview: On a cold Christmas Eve, hungry Boonesborough awaits the birth of an Indian child who could reconcile two tribes.

episodes.name: The Tamarack Massacre Affair
episodes.overview: The sister of a British officer lies that she narrowly escaped an Indian massacre; Boone must avert war.

episodes.name: Gabriel
episodes.overview: A Spanish military expedition chasing a French revolutionary mistakes Boone for its quarry.

episodes.name: Seminole Territory
episodes.overview: After Seminoles hail him a god, a magician lets his power go to his head.

episodes.name: The Deserter
episodes.overview: A bounty hunter seeking Army deserters learns one of his captives is valuable Boone.

episodes.name: Crisis by Fire
episodes.overview: A former Continental Army officer uses a smallpox threat to raise troops against Indians.

episodes.name: The Gun
episodes.overview: Boone heads to Pennsylvania to have a new gun made, but meets two scoundrels seeking a guide to the Mississippi.

episodes.name: The Prisoners
episodes.overview: Three escaped Army prisoners, seeking revenge on a former commander, pressure Boone by seizing his children.

episodes.name: The Fifth Man
episodes.overview: Boone and his party endure hardship to blow up a bridge between the advancing British and Fort Wayne.

episodes.name: The Gun-Barrel Highway
episodes.overview: Cassady was supposed to build a new road in the wilderness around Shawnee land. But when he decides there isn't enough time before winter to build the longer route, he decides to go straight through Shawnee land and into a possible war.

episodes.name: The Search
episodes.overview: An ambush on the way to New Orleans leaves Boone in possession of a famous pirate s journal.

episodes.name: Fifty Rifles
episodes.overview: William Blunt, an old friend of Boone's, steals a wagon carrying fifty rifles and powder, which he intends to sell to the Shawnee. Daniel, along with Mingo and Jericho, must find Blunt and recover the rifles before a deal with the chief is made.

episodes.name: The Trap
episodes.overview: Renegades take Israel hostage when they find him and injured Mingo in the forest.

episodes.name: The Accused
episodes.overview: Mingo arranges a prison break to free Boone after a couple frames him for murder.

episodes.name: Cibola
episodes.overview: A man finds only danger when he seeks a fabled city of gold.

episodes.name: The High Cumberland (1)
episodes.overview: On his way through Kentucky, Boone meets his future wife, makes an Indian friend and uncovers deception.

episodes.name: The High Cumberland (2)
episodes.overview: Daniel Boone continues his trek to Kentucky. In the conclusion of this two-part episode detailing the early years of Daniel Boone's life he must lead a party of settlers through a canyon and take a stand against pursuers who want their precious supplies all the while defeating rival Jim Santee for the affections of one Rebecca Bryan

episodes.name: Dan'l Boone Shot a B'ar
episodes.overview: Boone faces a killer bear and the man who has sworn vengeance on the animal.

episodes.name: The Allegiances
episodes.overview: Mingo struggles with his divided heritage when an Indian council announces the British will help recapture Indian land.

episodes.name: Goliath
episodes.overview: Fearing three vengeful brothers, Otis spends money given to him for draft horses on a husky slave.

episodes.name: Grizzly
episodes.overview: Israel helps clear a wild-looking mountain man accused of murdering a man who refused to pay a debt.

episodes.name: First in War, First in Peace
episodes.overview: Washington visits in answer to a letter from Boone, who never wrote to him.

episodes.name: Run a Crooked Mile
episodes.overview: Israel is taken captive so Boone will help steal a war hero s body and then extort money from the family.

episodes.name: The Matchmaker
episodes.overview: Boone and Mingo agree to transport an unwilling Creek princess to an arranged wedding with a Shawnee.

episodes.name: Onatha
episodes.overview: Boone employs a mastodon s skeleton to fight two slave traders seeking runaway slaves.

episodes.name: The Loser's Race
episodes.overview: Daniel and the other settlers in Boonesborough will lose their land if they do not pay a new tax of one shilling per acre within two weeks. As Daniel is about to take the money to Williamsburg an old friend shows up offering to help.

episodes.name: The Enchanted Gun
episodes.overview: A Shawnee faces danger when he believes in the magic of a gun given to him by Boone for saving Israel s life.

episodes.name: Requiem for Craw Green
episodes.overview: Mingo masquerades as white to help an Indian boy condemned by the bigoted head of a settlement.

episodes.name: The Lost Colony
episodes.overview: A buckskin-clad girl leads Boone to a lost colony of settlers in a valley feared by Indians.

episodes.name: River Passage
episodes.overview: Boone fights a dishonest boatman and Shawnee to deliver gunpowder to Boonesborough.

episodes.name: When a King Is a Pawn
episodes.overview: Boone and Israel foil a plot to grab a French prince and send him back to a revolutionary tribunal.

episodes.name: The Symbol
episodes.overview: An impoverished nobleman acquires the Liberty Bell and decides to sell it to the British.

episodes.name: The Williamsburg Cannon (1)
episodes.overview: Virginia's governor, Patrick Henry, assigns Daniel to escort a somewhat nervous artillery captain and his cannon through hostile territory, and the fact that the cannon is large and hard to maneuver is making the journey more difficult.

episodes.name: The Williamsburg Cannon (2)
episodes.overview: Virginia's governor Patrick Henry assigns Daniel to escort a somewhat nervous artillery captain and his cannon through hostile territory, and the fact that the cannon is large and hard to maneuver is making the journey more difficult.

episodes.name: The Wolf Man
episodes.overview: As Boonesborough awaits a slavery vote, a frontiersman struggles to protect his pet wolf from townspeople.

episodes.name: The Jasper Ledbedder Story
episodes.overview: Daniel and Mingo find an old colonist named Jasper Ledbedder who claims that Native Americans abducted his wife and child after his party had a massacre. They agree to help him, even though they suspect his story is not entirely true.

episodes.name: When I Became a Man, I Put Away Childish Things
episodes.overview: Israel runs away with his pet fawn when Boone says the destructive animal, too tame to set free, must be killed.

episodes.name: The Long Way Home
episodes.overview: Boone sets out to recapture a prisoner, an educated black accused of murdering an Indian chief.

episodes.name: The Young Ones
episodes.overview: An orphan, determined to keep his family together, causes trouble for rescuer Boone.

episodes.name: Delo Jones
episodes.overview: A fugitive from Virginia, Delo Jones, comes to Boonesborough ahead of a British contingent determined to arrest him for a murder. Daniel believes he may be innocent and plans a trap to catch the real killer.

episodes.name: The Necklace
episodes.overview: A dying man confesses to murder and theft, producing a pearl necklace as proof, and tells of the innocent man to be hanged for his crimes. Against townsfolks' wishes, Daniel takes the necklace to New Orleans to secure the freedom of the accused man.

episodes.name: Fort West Point
episodes.overview: Boone and Mingo try to stop the commandant of West Point from selling the fort to the British.

episodes.name: Bitter Mission
episodes.overview: A traitor's plan to profit from war with the Spanish backfires.

episodes.name: Take the Southbound Stage
episodes.overview: Rebecca decides to help Boone rescue President John Adams from kidnappers.

episodes.name: The Fallow Land
episodes.overview: After fur-trappers break a treaty, a Cherokee chief s hotheaded son tries to start a war.

episodes.name: The Ballad of Sidewinder and the Cherokee
episodes.overview: Boone and wounded Mingo ask a river pirate to help retrieve furs from a thief.

episodes.name: The Ordeal of Israel Boone
episodes.overview: Israel must call upon all he has learned to save Boone from a rattlesnake bite.

episodes.name: The Renegade
episodes.overview: An Indian jailed for murder escapes and comes to take revenge on witness Boone and recover his son from settlers.

episodes.name: Tanner
episodes.overview: Israel helps a starving outcast who is haunted by memories of the Shawnee murdering his parents.

episodes.name: Beaumarchais
episodes.overview: Boone guides a French ally, masquerading as an actor, who is traveling to Roanoke to buy guns for the Continental Army.

episodes.name: The King's Shilling
episodes.overview: A father takes a soldier hostage to force British troops to free his rebel son.

episodes.name: The Inheritance
episodes.overview: Strange happenings greet Rebecca and Israel when they visit a seaside house left to Rebecca by her uncle.

episodes.name: The Traitor
episodes.overview: Sentenced to death by the British, Boone will be spared if he rescues a colonel s daughter from Shawnee.

episodes.name: The Value of a King
episodes.overview: A slavehunter chains Boone with a group of escaped slaves then is attacked by Shawnee.

episodes.name: The Desperate Raid
episodes.overview: Boone teaches a lieutenant about backwoods fighting during an attack on a British cannon installation.

episodes.name: The Spanish Horse
episodes.overview: A boy, whose father was killed by Indians, faces the loss of his beloved horse.

episodes.name: Chief Mingo
episodes.overview: The murder of a Cherokee chief, perhaps by a bigoted trapper, makes Mingo temporary head of the tribe.

episodes.name: The Secret Code
episodes.overview: Ottawas capture Boone while he is trying to free a code expert from the British, then plan to torture him to death.

episodes.name: A Matter of Blood
episodes.overview: A Delaware, raised by a white planter, must prove herself a worthy tribal leader.

episodes.name: The Scrimshaw Ivory Chart
episodes.overview: A crow switches a rock for Israel s silver coin and leads him to a pirate seeking treasure.

episodes.name: The Imposter
episodes.overview: Mingo masquerades as a British major to steal a shipment of rapid-firing rifles.

episodes.name: The Witnesses
episodes.overview: A killer terrorizes witnesses Israel and friends into silence.

episodes.name: The Flaming Rocks
episodes.overview: Daniel, Mingo, and Jeremiah encounter the Garth family, whose patriarch is forcing the local Indians to mine coal. The chief of the Tuscarora threatens to kill them all if Daniel doesn't intervene and stop him.

episodes.name: Then Who Will They Hang from the Yardarm If Willy Gets Away?
episodes.overview: Israel befriends an accused British mutineer pursued by a shipmate sought for two murders.

episodes.name: The Spanish Fort
episodes.overview: Boone lets the Spanish capture him as part of a plan to blow up a partially completed Virginia fort.

episodes.name: Hero's Welcome
episodes.overview: Boone helps an old friend who lost his son because his neighbors think him a coward.

episodes.name: Orlando, the Prophet
episodes.overview: The Boones befriend a scheming medicine man's Gypsy bond-servant.

episodes.name: The Far Side of Fury
episodes.overview: Believing his son dead, Gideon takes revenge on Boone by stealing Israel.

episodes.name: Nightmare
episodes.overview: The Boone family is on the trail when they are beset by a rogue group of hostile Indians. When Daniel is captured Israel must find a way to rescue him.

episodes.name: Thirty Pieces of Silver
episodes.overview: A wagon load of guns is headed for Boonesborough with Daniel and Mingo in charge. An outlaw named Dekker plans to steal the wagon using information bought from Amos Fargo. Unknown to Fargo, his sister is traveling with Boone.

episodes.name: Faith's Way
episodes.overview: A local woman is looked upon suspiciously by the townspeople because of her "different" ways.

episodes.name: Be Thankful for the Fickleness of Women
episodes.overview: Josh buys a pretty bondservant, then may have to marry her when she falls for him.

episodes.name: The Blackbirder
episodes.overview: A bounty hunter seeking a naval deserter is tricked into capturing Boone s friend Gideon as an escaped slave.

episodes.name: The Dandy
episodes.overview: Daniel agrees to a request of a friend to take his son, whom he regards as spoiled and irresponsible, and teach him the ways of the wilderness and learn something more manly than the painting the young man seems most interested in. Daniel and the young man both get more than they were bargaining for in the process.

episodes.name: The Fleeing Nuns
episodes.overview: On the way to New Orleans, Boone and a friend help two nuns, then learn one is an aristocrat fleeing the French Revolution.

episodes.name: The Plague That Came to Ford's Run
episodes.overview: Josh returns to his hometown to visit a friend but finds the community a wreck and his friend missing.

episodes.name: The Bait
episodes.overview: A woman and her boyfriend rob Boone's stagecoach and steal his tax money.

episodes.name: Big, Black and Out There
episodes.overview: A former slave, adopted by Indians, terrorizes and robs Boonesborough.

episodes.name: Flag of Truce
episodes.overview: An Army general plans to use Boone as bait in a trap for the frontiersman s friend, a Wyandot chief.

episodes.name: The Valley of the Sun
episodes.overview: While on a hunting trip with Daniel, Josh Clements meets mad collector Sir Hubert and is then held prisoner in a cavern filled with treasures of the Aztec sun god.

episodes.name: The Patriot
episodes.overview: John Gist had gone to Canada rather than fight the British. Now, after American independence, he wants to come back and live again on his land. Daniel is caught in the middle trying to help his friend against those who see him as a traitor.

episodes.name: The Return of Sidewinder
episodes.overview: Highwaymen - known as "buckaroos" - are robbing people around Boonesborough. After the British offer a rich reward for their capture, Daniel discovers the man responsible is an old adversary from a time when he and Mingo were robbed.

episodes.name: Minnow for a Shark
episodes.overview: Israel finds himself in the middle of a plot by a British Commodore to use a box of gold to find a thief, who may or may not be his friend, the one-armed Capt. Jack.

episodes.name: To Slay a Giant
episodes.overview: Gideon is accused of murdering Cyrus Blake and his revenge minded brother, Enoch, is determined to hang him now rather than wait for a trial.

episodes.name: A Tall Tale of Prater Beasely
episodes.overview: Prater Beasley is a teller of tall tales, but Israel and a disabled friend decide to follow him to see the mythical bear he talks about. Beasley may be just what the disabled boy, caught between an overprotective mother and an overly macho father, really needs.

episodes.name: Copperhead Izzy
episodes.overview: Israel is abducted and forced to live with a group of street urchins who work as pickpockets. With Daniel away on business, Rebecca and her uncle Brian have to find Israel and rescue the other children.

episodes.name: Three Score and Ten
episodes.overview: An elderly man, who has worn out his welcome in town with his tall tales, takes up residence with the Shawnee, who enjoy his stories immensely. However, they are more interested in his wagonload of rifle parts and have plans for their use.

episodes.name: Jonah
episodes.overview: Josh inherits a section of land and a slave to teach him how to farm. When two men show up in Boonesborough, one with a reputation as a fighter, Josh, who has no interest in farming, sets up a bout between the man and Jonah, who fought for Josh's uncle at one time, and risks his land. When Jonah refuses to fight, Josh must take his place and try to win the bet.

episodes.name: Bickford's Bridge
episodes.overview: Boone has orders from the Army to blow up bridges along the western frontier to prevent a British attack. When he reaches the last bridge he is blocked by a farmer who must keep it open in order to transport his autumn harvest.

episodes.name: A Touch of Charity
episodes.overview: To help out Jimmy McGill, a penniless young man swindled in a land deal, Daniel offers him a piece of land to be paid for over time. When Amos Brown's daughter Charity, betrothed to another, is attracted to Jimmy, Brown forbids her to see him and moves up her wedding to a local man. To claim Charity before she weds the other man, McGill decides to make a fortune overnight.

episodes.name: For Want of a Hero
episodes.overview: On their way back home Daniel and his family plan to stop at a fort for the night. When they arrive they find it has been destroyed by Indians with only a few survivors. The surviving soldiers seem to be hiding some kind of secret.

episodes.name: Love and Equity
episodes.overview: In a semi-comic episode, Prater Beasley is called back to Boonesborough to get rid of a ground squirrel problem. Unfortunately, his methods get him into trouble, as he gets accused of fraud and even witchcraft.

episodes.name: The Allies
episodes.overview: Daniel and friends Mason and Cully are on a mission to stop an alliance between the British and the Chickasaw and Choctaw. To do this they plan to blow up a gorge on the route the British are taking, but on their way their horses are stolen by a vagabond family of three. When they catch the trio they decide to take them along, though they're not sure they can trust the crafty patriarch of the clan.

episodes.name: A Man Before His Time
episodes.overview: A fugitive is being tracked through the woods where he is killed in a confrontation. The man's only son is now an orphan and, after Daniel takes him back to town, plots revenge against them.

episodes.name: For a Few Rifles
episodes.overview: A man believes he has purchased land in Shawnee territory, but Daniel is certain that the Shawnee did not have anything to do with selling the land. When they go to meet the chief to try to work something out, he says he will give the man the land if the tribe gets twenty rifles. When Daniel refuses this offer, he finds out that Israel has been taken hostage in exchange for the rifles. While being held Israel meets a crippled and bitter Shawnee youth.

episodes.name: Sweet Molly Malone
episodes.overview: Sgt. Malone is a hard drinking, pipe smoking veteran of the war. The Sgt. is also a woman, which puts her at odds with the town folk. Rebecca decides she needs a man and matches her with a peddler who once fought with the Hessians.

episodes.name: A Pinch of Salt
episodes.overview: While on a surveying mission for the Continental Congress, Daniel and David get caught in the middle of a dispute between two women and a man bent on destroying their salt mine operation.

episodes.name: A Very Small Rifle
episodes.overview: A young Cherokee boy is shot and is near death. Daniel Boone must find out who shot the boy in order to head off the angry Cherokee tribe from retaliating against everyone, killing many innocent people.

episodes.name: The Road to Freedom
episodes.overview: A runaway slave and his son are on the run from three bounty hunters. When the father breaks his leg the son continues on and turns to Israel and Ben for help.

episodes.name: Benvenuto... Who?
episodes.overview: Visiting New Orleans to sell the furs they've trapped, Daniel and Josh become mixed up with a beautiful French jewel thief who is attempting to double-cross the rest of her gang. The gullible Josh falls for the scheming woman's charms, which allows her to hide the stolen bauble inside his guitar.

episodes.name: The Man
episodes.overview: A former slave, now a chief of the Tuscarora, helps Daniel lead a ragtag group of soldiers on an operation against the British.

episodes.name: The Printing Press
episodes.overview: Daniel and Israel Boone visit Benjamin Franklin at his home in Philadelphia. While there, they are forced to match wits with the British Army.

episodes.name: The Traitor
episodes.overview: The British commander of Fort Detroit will turn over the fort's defense plan if the Americans will reunite him with his wife. Daniel and Cully escort her back to him but Daniel doubts the Colonel's willingness to be a traitor.

episodes.name: The Grand Alliance
episodes.overview: Josh and Gabe are captured by a Spanish officer who tells them another Spanish officer is secretly building a base from which he intends to invade the U.S. He asks them to infiltrate the fort and steal his plans to prevent another war.

episodes.name: Target Boone
episodes.overview: Daniel and his family find themselves being continually terrorized by an old man and his sons. The old man blames Boone for the death of his wife and for leaving him crippled, even though Daniel has no memory of ever meeting him.

episodes.name: A Bearskin for Jamie Blue
episodes.overview: While trading furs Daniel acquires an indentured servant who was born in prison and has never been free. Daniel intends to release him from service but the young man has trouble adjusting to his new life.

episodes.name: The Cache
episodes.overview: When a trapper is murdered Josh is fingered as the killer. Daniel encourages him to surrender with the idea that the real killers will be easier to catch once he is in custody. But will Josh be hanged before they're caught?

episodes.name: The Terrible Tarbots
episodes.overview: While transporting a box filled with gold for the Continental army, Daniel is beset upon by thieves. Complicating matters is that Israel is taken hostage as protection from Daniel while they lug the gold over the mountains.

episodes.name: Hannah Comes Home
episodes.overview: A woman long thought dead is discovered by Daniel living with the Chickasaw. Daniel tells her her husband is still alive and that she should come back. She does, but her husband has trouble accepting her Indian son.

episodes.name: An Angel Cried
episodes.overview: Josh discovers that an Indian party has burned down a mission with the only surviving nun hiding in a root cellar. They struggle to elude the Indians until help can finally arrive and save them.

episodes.name: Perilous Passage
episodes.overview: Daniel and Gabe become prisoners of the British after blowing up an important bridge. After escaping custody with another prisoner, they slowly work their way home through enemy territory. But they may be pawns in a larger plan.

episodes.name: The Sunshine Patriots
episodes.overview: Josh and Gabe are sent to Yorktown to intercept the arrival of Sir Peacham, an eccentric inventor, who is employed by the British but secretly sympathetic to the Americans. Josh and Gabe's mission is complicated by his daughter's intrigues.

episodes.name: Mama Cooper
episodes.overview: Gabe encounters a child with a doll that he believes could have only been made by his mother, whom he hasn't seen since he was a child, and sets out to find her.

episodes.name: Before the Tall Man
episodes.overview: Rebecca decides to play matchmaker to Tom and Nancy, two people Daniel doesn't think go together. Considering how much they fight each other he might be right. But Rebecca thinks she knows better.

episodes.name: Run for the Money
episodes.overview: Cincinnatus thinks he has found the fastest runner around and brings him to Boonesborough for a big race. His dream for success is complicated when another unknown runner enters the race and that the runners have a scheme of their own.

episodes.name: A Matter of Vengeance
episodes.overview: A man who lost his parents years before blames a scarred stranger.

episodes.name: The Landlords
episodes.overview: Boone poses as a pirate to outwit a swindler who sold simpleton brothers a deed to Boonesborough

episodes.name: Readin', Ritin', and Revolt
episodes.overview: Israel joins forces with an Indian classmate to force the teaching of a course in Indian culture.

episodes.name: Noblesse Oblige
episodes.overview: A cook posing as a French prince falls in love in Boonesborough;

episodes.name: L'Ã‰preuve d'IsraÃ«l Boone
episodes.overview: Israel befriends an elderly Indian plotting revenge for his tribe s near-extinction.

episodes.name: Bringing Up Josh
episodes.overview: While in New Orleans with Daniel, Josh 'inherits' two abandoned children from a poor widow. Unwilling to leave them to become orphans, he takes them with him back home only to find caring for two kids is a lot harder than he thought.

episodes.name: How to Become a Goddess
episodes.overview: Two inept brothers stumble into the middle of an Indian religious ceremony. Desperate to save their lives, they promise to bring back a woman whose hair is like fire, a description that conveniently describes Rebecca Boone.

episodes.name: Israel and Love
episodes.overview: Israel finds first love with the daughter of a flamboyant woodcarver.
